channel.title: Cache problem mapsconfig.txt
channel.description:
Hey everyone. I have been having some cache problems if anyone can help me.. Whenever I run my client I get this error.
I have the mapconfig.txt in the folder and ready to go.. other then that it doesnt work.
I have skype, I have my cache dropbox code in there perfectly fine.. can only help or teamviewer me?
[code]java.io.FileNotFoundException: nullData\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot fi nd the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:138) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:93) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(FileReader.java:58) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:219) at client.startUp(client.java:8351) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:84) at client.run(client.java:5334) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) [/code]

item.title: Cache problem mapsconfig.txt
item.dc:creator: @emperor1975 emperor1975
item.description:
@emperor1975 wrote:

K Sk8r try teamviewering and check the signlink

Read full topic

item.title: Cache problem mapsconfig.txt
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

emperor1975:

Make sure that your cache is in the c: drive

That, again, isn’t even the issue. Read my post. The signlink path (Assuming it’s using that) is returning null.

Read full topic

item.title: Cache problem mapsconfig.txt
item.dc:creator: @emperor1975 emperor1975
item.description:
@emperor1975 wrote:

Make sure that your cache is in the c: drive

Read full topic

item.title: Cache problem mapsconfig.txt
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Coldmedicine, post:3, topic:548934”]In your cache,

In maps

Add a file called

mapConfig.txt

Or remove the code where it reads it.[/quote]
Don’t be blind?

[b]nullData\Maps\mapConfig.txt[/b]
OP. That's your error right there^ The client isn't reading the right path to your cache.

Read full topic
